dc:description:
The RAB27A gene is located on chromosome 15 at 15q21.3 and encodes the RAB27A protein, which is a member of the family of small GTPases involved in vesicular fusion and trafficking. The RAB27A gene was first reported in relation to autosomal recessive Griscelli syndrome in 2000 (Pastural et al., PMID: 10704277). Biallelic variants in RAB27A (including nonsense, frameshift, splice, and missense variants) were subsequently identified in 16 patients with Griscelli syndrome by Menasche et al., 2000 (PMID: 10835631). The patients exhibited various degrees of skin hypopigmentation and a silvery-gray sheen of the hair with large pigment aggregates in hair shafts. In all of these patients, at least 1 episode of hemophagocytic syndrome had occurred, characterized by acute onset of uncontrolled lymphocyte and macrophage activation, resulting in infiltration and hemophagocytosis in multiple organs. This form is referred to as Griscelli syndrome, type 2 (MIM: 607624). Evidence supporting this gene-disease relationship includes case-level data and experimental data. Variants in this gene have been reported in at least fifteen probands in ten publications (Schuster et al., 2011 PMID: 11571516; Arico et al., 2002 PMID 12098069; Sanal et al., 2002 PMID: 12148598; Anikster et al., 2002 PMID: 12058346; Aksu et al., 2003 PMID: 12525785; Sheela et al., 2004 PMID 15475639; Bizario et al., 2004 PMID: 15163896; Meschede et al., 2008 PMID: 19030707). The gene-disease relationship is supported experimental evidence including a mouse model, which show pigmentary dilution of coat color and abnormal distribution of melanosome in ashen mice (Wilson et al., 2000 PMID: 10859366), and the inability of cytotoxic T lymphocytes from ashen mice to kill target cells or to secrete granzyme A and hexosaminidase (Stinchcombe et al., 2001 PMID: 11266472). In summary, the RAB27A gene is definitely associated with Griscelli syndrome, type 2 (autosomal recessive inheritance). This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings and has been upheld over time.

Due to the overlapping phenotype of Griscelli Syndrome type 2 (GS2) with immunodeficiency and immune dysregulation, the PIRD GCEP has provided an addendum to this gene curation.

Patients with GS2 can have normal NK cell phenotyping with aberrant NK cell cytotoxicity, CD107a degranulation and antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC). There can be phenotypic heterogeneity in GS2, even with a single pathogenic RAB27A variant, with severely affected and asymptomatic patients. Also, heterozygous RAB27A variants (c.259G>C) have been reported to develop HLH features and demonstrated decreased NK cell cytotoxicity, granule polarization and degranulation but had normal immune synapse formation, suggesting there is a partial dominant-negative effect with this variant. Further, a novel structural variant at the 5'UTR of RAB27A causes an atypical form of GS2 with late-onset HLH, including neuroinflammation, skin granulomas, lymphoma but normal pigmentation. A different novel RAB27A variant (c.551G>A) resulted in late-onset HLH with EBV-driven lymphoproliferation. This variant also results in normal pigmentation and demonstrated variability in effector protein binding with strong binding to MUNC13-4 and attenuated binding to SLP2A with impaired lymphocyte exocytosis.

PMIDs: 26880764; 29522846; https://doi.org/10.1002/ajmg.a.61829; DOI: 10.1007/s10875-022-01315-4
curationReasonDescription: >2 publications about gene-disease relationship since original publication in year 2000.

evidence.dc:description: Immunofluorescence studies with an anti–TRP-1 antibody confirmed the biased distribution of melanosomes in GS melanocytes and evidenced the absence of accumulation of melanosomes at their dendrite tips. Immunofluorescence study failed to detect Rab27a in GS melanocytes. The results show that these GS melanocytes have an abnormal distribution of melanosomes and a normal expression of myosin-V, but no expression of Rab27a.
evidence.rdfs:label: Immunofluorescence study

evidence.dc:description: myosinVa coimmunoprecipitates with anti-Rab27a antibodies from melanocytes and mouse tissues. Immunofluorescence microscopy showed that Rab27a and myosinVa colocalize in wild-type melanocytes, but absent from melanosomes in Rab27a mutant ashen melanocytes.
evidence.rdfs:label: Immunoprecipitation

evidence.dc:description: Re-expression of Rab27a in GS melanocytes restored melanosome transport to dendrite tips, leading to a phenotypic reversion of the diseased cells.
evidence.rdfs:label: Construction of Expression Plasmids and Transfection

evidence.dc:description: Retroviral gene transfer restores cytotoxicity of RAB27A mutant T cells. Cytotoxic activity of the Rab27a-retrovirus infected cells is comparable to healthy control cells, whereas the patient’s cells infected with GFP-retrovirus or non-infected cells showed low levels of activity.
evidence.rdfs:label: retroviral transfection of RAB27A cDNA to patient's cells

evidence.dc:description: Immunoblot of cell lysates from ashen mice exhibits no detectable endogenous Rab27a. Cytotoxicity and secretion assays show that ash/ash cytotoxic T lymphocytes CTLs are unable to kill target cells or secrete granzyme A and hexosaminidase.
evidence.rdfs:label: Cytotoxicity and secretion assay

evidence.dc:description: BAC rescue showed coat colour rescue. In addition to pigment defects, ash mice have defects in platelet dense granules. However, this observation does not explain human's phenotype of hemophagocytic syndrome.

Pigmentary dilution of coat color observed in ash mice. RT-PCR analysis showed that Rab27a expression is altered in ash Mice. Melanocyte cell lines isolated from skin of mutant mice showed melanosomes clump in the perinuclear region of even though they have normal dendritic arbors. The pigmentary dilution and abnormal distribution of pigments, characterized by the presence of large clumps of pigments is also observed in humans.
evidence.rdfs:label: Characterization of ashen mice
GM_P17
evidence.detectionMethod: Sequencing PCR products from genomic DNA encompassing exons 2-6 of RAB2A gene
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: microscopy examination of the hair shaft showed typical clumps of pigment

evidence.dc:description: Computational predicted to affect residues highly conserved among RAB proteins. Nucleotide binding and GTPase activity were measured by filtration method. Ala152Pro mutants did not bind to GTP or GDP nucleotide, suggesting that introduction of proline residue in Rab27a protein interferes with guanine nucleotide-binding activity, and that the mutations perturb the overall structure of the protein (12446441)

evidence.rdfs:label: IPM_P1
evidence.detectionMethod: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification of the RAB27A gene. PCR products were sequenced directly.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Patient with silvery-gray hair, immunodeficiency, hepatosplenomegaly. Had identical twin brother who presented with secondary severe neurological symptoms that culminated in multiple organ failure and death. Light microscopy examination of the hair showed large, irregular clumps of pigments characteristic of Griscelli syndrome.

evidence.rdfs:label: GM_P9
evidence.detectionMethod: Sequencing PCR products from genomic DNA encompassing exons 2-6 of RAB2A gene
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: microscopy examination of the hair shaft showed typical clumps of pigment

evidence.dc:description: Computational predicted to lies within a conserved GTP-binding motif. Trp73Gly mutant construct neither interacts with the Rab27a effector melanophilin nor modifies melanosome distribution and cytotoxic granule exocytosis. Substitutions introduced at the 73 position, including the leucine residue present in Ras, did not restore Rab27a protein functions (12446441).

evidence.rdfs:label: GA_P1
evidence.detectionMethod: Segregation of the disease in this family (mother and proband sample analyzed) was compatible with the GS locus. Variant in RAB2A identified.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Silvery hair: analysis of hair shaft under light microscopy revealed irregularly distributed small and large clumps of melanin. Skin biopsy findings matched with partial albinism. Recurrent fever, hepatosplenomegaly, neutropenia-thrombocytopenia, hypogammaglobulinemia, degenerative white matter disease, family history of a female sibling dying at age of 5

evidence.dc:description: Not enough affected individuals to score for segregation
evidence.rdfs:label: Family 1(P1 &P2)

evidence.dc:description: Four affected children, but only one genotyped
evidence.rdfs:label: YA

evidence.dc:description:
Patient A:2 and A:3 are identical twins, therefore counted as 1 individual. 
There is not enough affected individuals for calculating LOD score.
evidence.rdfs:label: A
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Fever, splenomegaly, hepatomegaly, low to pathological NK cell activity, hair pathology

evidence.dc:description: Does not have enough affected individuals to count for segregation.
evidence.rdfs:label: AR

evidence.dc:description: Not enough affected individuals in a family to score for segregation
evidence.rdfs:label: Family 2 (P3+P4)

evidence.dc:description: Does not have enough affected individuals (at least 3) to count for segregations
evidence.rdfs:label: GM_P4

Leu130Pro mutants did not bind to GTP or GDP nucleotide, suggesting that introduction of proline residue in Rab27a protein interferes with guanine nucleotide-binding activity, and that the mutations perturb the overall structure of the protein (12446441)

evidence.detectionMethod: Sequencing PCR products from genomic DNA encompassing exons 2-6 of RAB2A gene
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: microscopy examination of the hair shaft showed typical clumps of pigment

evidence.dc:description: Recurring mutation in 3 other unrelated patients in the same cohort. Cells from P7, who carry the same homozygous variant, displayed very low cytotoxic activity of T lymphocytes

evidence.rdfs:label: GM_P2
evidence.detectionMethod: Sequencing PCR products from genomic DNA encompassing exons 2-6 of RAB2A gene
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: microscopy examination of the hair shaft showed typical clumps of pigment

evidence.rdfs:label: JCSB_P1
evidence.detectionMethod: Direct sequencing of the PCR products of RAB27A and MYO5a
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Silvery-gray hair, recurrent fever episodes including three pneumonias and cytopenias, such as neutropenia, thrombocytopenia, bone marrow smears haemophagocytosis, hepatosplenomegaly, pancytopenia. Repeated convulsive episode at 4 years old.
